He knew the fox as Tails, Sonic's best friend and the one who helped Sonic kick his ass those many years ago. On one hand it would be a nice revenge to kill Tails for ruining his career and making him start over; on the other hand he was just a kid when that happened and Nack had actually become more successful because of his defeat. He just couldn't find it in him to want revenge, it was just another job now.

Nack had scoped this spot out weeks ago under the cover of night. Now he would spend a few days learning the fox's routine and pick the perfect time to strike. He didn't have his rifle with him, that would just be extra weight if he needed to high-tail it out of there. He hid in a thick bush on a hill above the fox's house, binoculars in hand to peer into his mark's home. He was able to see all but the farthest corners of the boy's bedroom from his vantage point.

"Boy..." he realized what he had just thought, "that's not right. He was a kid when I last saw him; he's probably a young adult by now. You're letting yourself remember who he was, Nack," he scolded himself. "If you give them a history, a life, you won't want to shoot them. Get your head out of the past."

He looked back into the room. The sun was rising behind him, adding to his camouflage. He could see the fox lying sound asleep in bed. He turned over in his sleep, slapping the clock next to his bed. Nack checked his own watch; it was 6:00. The fox groggily rolled over and threw his covers off.

Nack led Tails to his ship, happy that his plan seemed to be working. Tails didn't seem to recognize him, and since he had been called Fang the Sniper when the kid knew him, his real name didn't throw the boy off. He was probably in his early twenties, but he had such a cute face and slim build that Nack still though of him as a boy. He could just kick Tails inside when they got there and take off, but he preferred to take off without a struggle. He decided he would win the fox over the old fashioned way and slip him a spiked drink when he got the chance. If that didn't work, he could always use the tranquilizer dart in his pistol. Nack had crashed his ship into the trees right over the hill from Tails's house, just enough to make a mess but nothing he couldn't fix on his own. He knew Tails could fix it, so he would just play dumb while the fox worked. After an hour, Tails emerged from under the ship, covered in grease with spanner in hand.

"There we go, you should be good for takeoff, just watch the rockets until you get above the tree line."

"Hey, thanks a million, pal," Nack shook his hand. "Tell you what, let me buy you dinner as a thank you. You really saved my ass there."

Tails dismissed the offer at first, but Nack insisted. They headed into town to a bar where Tails said they made the best chili dogs on Mobius. Kids a cheap date, Nack chuckled mentally. After dinner, they moved to the bar for a few rounds and began to chat. Talk moved to what Nack was doing on Mobius and why he crashed.

"Funny story actually," the weasel started his fabricated backstory. "I came here to learn how to work on spaceships. I wanted to get into the repair business since my home planet only got one company that fixes them. Bit of a monopoly if you ask me. Guess I got a little too ambitious though..."

"Aw, cheer up," Tails reassured him. "It's not as hard as it looks. You'll get it."

"Well, you seem to know a lot about them. Would you mind teaching me a little? I'll be hanging around in my ship until I get my application into the school, so if it wouldn't be too much trouble I'd like to not look like a complete idiot."

"No problem, I like teaching people about this stuff. Actually, if you want, you can stay in my guest room instead of your ship. I have a lab where I can show you a lot of the basics."

"Really? I wouldn't be a burden?"

"No, you'll be fine. That's why I have a guest room. Just grab whatever you need from your ship and come on over."

This was going even better than Nack had planned. This kid was really trusting, almost naive. It shouldn't take too long to get him at this pace. By the time they finished their drinks, Tails had a nice buzz going. Nack had to help him out a little in getting home, then got some stuff out of his ship before returning.

"Okay, Nack," Tails showed him to the guest room, a bedroom addition off of the garage with its own bathroom. It would be locked out of the rest of the house, but hopefully Nack could change that. "Make yourself at home."

"Okay, would you mind if I undressed? I saw that's how you like it here, but I don't want to be creepy or anything."

"Oh," Tails thought a moment. "Well I guess I can't really say no after what happened this morning. Maybe I'll take these off too." Nack couldn't believe how easy this was. One day and they're already naked in a room together!

When Tails saw what Nack was packing, he couldn't help but stare. "Wow, you're bigger than I am!"

"Oh, sorry," Nack said.

"No no, that's fine," Tails stumbled over his words a bit. "It's just that I've never met anyone as big as I am, let alone bigger."

"Yeah, it's good genes I guess."

Tails continued to stare at Nack's piece. The weasel could guess that Tails was gay, or at least bi, but his buzz seemed to be making him less aware of how awkward this was. After all, they had only "known" each other for a few hours. Nack decided to make his move a little early.

The sun slowly filtered through the curtains in Sakura Kinimoto's room its bright light shining on her sleeping face. Slowly her eyes opened and she sat up, rubbing them slowly, still half asleep. She looked at the clock and her eyes shot wide open.

"Augh! I'm late!"

She threw back the covers on her bed and ran over to her dresser, throwing off her pajamas and getting dressed in her school uniform. Just as she was about to grab her backpack and run downstairs for a quick breakfast, she saw a strange glowing coming from the Clow Book. She opened it and saw the cards were all glowing. She pulled them out and looked through them. Nothing seemed to be wrong with them other than that they were glowing. She pulled open the drawer to Kero's room and shook him awake.

"Kero! Somethings wrong with the Clow cards."

Kero woke up yawned and said, "What's wrong Sakura?"

"Look at the Clow cards! They're glowing!"

Kero looked them over and said, "Oh, I was wondering when this was going to happen."

Sakura sighed and said, "Should I be worried?"

Kero laughed and said, "Naw, this isn't a big deal. The cards are glowing because you need to go on a mission to a different dimension."

"A different dimension?" Sakura said, looked nervous. "What do you mean?"

Kero picked up the Windy, which was on top of the deck, and said, "Every couple of decades the Clow cards all activate at once, sending their powers out in a radius reaching, oh, just about the size of this house. That's why you need to go to another dimension. If you didn't, then the cards powers would seek you out and you'd probably incinerated by the combined power."

"Wow, I guess Clow Reed didn't really think too hard about the dangers these cards possess..." Sakura said, turning the Shot over (which had been next in the deck).

Kero frowned and said, "Hey you can criticize him when you create 52 different powered cards."

Sakura frowned right back and said, "Well...I did create one!"

Kero looked triumphant and said, "Only 51 more than!"

Sakura "humphed" and said, "Well, when do I have to go?"

Kero flew over to her and said, "ASAP! Leave a note saying you went over to Tomoyo's house for the next few days or something so your dad and Touya don't worry."

Sakura quickly wrote out the note and left the house, her father and her brother already gone for the day. She was really late today! School passed rather uneventfully and once it was over, she pulled Kero out and said, "Alright, how do I go to this other dimension?"

"You're going to stay with a witch named Yuko. She was a friend of Clow Reeds, though I don't know how well they got along. You're going to have to help her servant Watanuki while you're there though. That's the price you pay for her bringing you to her dimension and, eventually, sending you back."

Sakura sighed and said, "Well, I suppose I don't mind cleaning up after someone. I'm used to cleaning after all. We all take turns."

"Alright then!" Kero said. "She should be sending your ride over soon."

As though on cue, a huge white column came down from the sky and surrounded Sakura, lifting back up into the sky with her in it. Kero sighed happily and wagged his tail, thinking, "Finally something is going right."

Again, as though on cue, hundreds of columns appeared descending all over the city. Kero yelled out as he saw this, wondering what was going on. He pulled out a small hand mirror and said, "Yuko! What's going on?"

A beautiful woman appeared in the mirror, her face expressionless. She smiled when she saw Kero and said, "I suppose you've noticed by now."

Kero shook the mirror and said, "What's going on?!?"

Yuko, still smiling, said, "All the women in your world are being taken away and put into a stasis between worlds for now."

"But why?"

"It's those cards that Reed made I suppose. This isn't an ordinary reaction. Something big is going to happen. Prepare yourself for the inevitable."

"Alright I guess. Won't people notice though? That all the women are gone?"

Yuko shook her head and said, "They won't notice a thing. This was magic on a mass scale. Those without magic powers won't notice it. So I suppose your Syaoran will notice it, though."

"Okay. Did Sakura get there at least?"

Yuko smiled and said, "Of course. Watanuki and her are getting along rather well."

Kero smiled too and said, "Well that's good. Hopefully this whole crazy thing will be over soon."

With that, Kero put the mirror away and flew back towards the Kinimoto household. Nothing had changed except that Sakura's room had disappeared. Whatever was causing this phenomenon had totally erased Sakura's presence for now at least. This puzzle Kero for a bit. If Sakura had never existed than how did the cards get captured? And further more, where was he staying? The door suddenly opened and Kero heard a voice call out, "Dad? Are you home yet?"

Kero freaked. Touya was back home from school already! He must not have to work today! Thinking fast, Kero collapsed and held still on the floor, trying to pass himself off as a plush toy.He was turned away from the stairs so he could only hear Touya's footsteps. They stopped and Kero saw Touya looking down at him, confusion clear in his eyes. "Uhh...Kero? What are you doing?"

Kero jumped up and shouted, "How do you know who I am?"

Touya sighed and said, "What happened? Did you bump your head or something? Why wouldn't I know you?"

Kero didn't really have an answer to that, so he just flew up to Touya's face and said, "How was school?"

Touya shrugged and said, "It was school. Things haven't been as interesting around here since we finished capturing the Clow cards."

Kero's jaw dropped as he heard this. Touya? A Cardcaptor? This confusion lasted until they both reached Touya's room and Kero pulled open a drawer on his desk. Inside was a similar set up to what Sakura had made for him. Touya saw him looking in and said, "What's wrong? Yukito's handiwork suddenly not good enough for you?"

Suddenly it all became clear. Sakura had never existed in this world, meaning that she had never opened the Clow Book or captured the cards. Instead, Touya had found and opened the book and captured the cards. Kero suddenly got an image of Touya wielding the pink sealing wand and wearing one of Tomoyo's outfits. He snorted in laughter at the image earning him a look of confusion from Touya. Kero coughed and said, "So the Clow cards haven't been acting up or anything have they?"

Touya stopped unpacking his backpack and said, "Actually they were all glowing this morning. I tried to tell you but you wouldn't wake up. They stopped a little while after that so I didn't think it was a big deal."

Kero crossed his arms and said, "We'd better check on them to be sure."

Touya pulled out the book and opened it. He pulled out the top two cards in the deck. The first was the Big, while the other was the Little. Touya looked surprised to see them and said, "These weren't the cards that were on top before. Usually Windy is on top."

Suddenly, one of the cards started glowing brightly! Touya and Kero shielded their eyes and felt a surge of magical energy.

Far away, in a different Japan, Yuko, who was relaxing on her deck, smoking a pipe, felt the surge from afar. She smiled and said, "It has begun."
155222212121.title: A Twist of Fate

choices: Touya gives in to thoughts of power and decides to shrink more people
Touya resists and decides to protect Yukito and look for a way to reverse this
1552222121211.content:
After a few seconds had passed, the card stopped glowing and Touya and Kero slowly unshielded their eyes. Touya cautiously picked the card up and said, "Well this is weird."

Kero flew up and hovered behind Touya's shoulder, staring at the card. "I've never seen anything like this before..."

The name of the card was still clearly there: Little. But the picture on the card was gone! It was as if someone had painted over her image on the card. In all his time spent with Clow Reed Kero had never encountered this nor had the magician ever mentioned anything like this. Could this just be some kind of natural flux in the cards power over time? Or was someone somehow manipulating the cards? Before they could discuss this further, the doorbell rang. Touya looked up from the card and shouted, "Coming!"

Kero flew off his shoulder as Touya put the empty Little card back into the book, closing it and putting it back into the top right drawer of his desk. Kero flew after Touya, wondering who was at the door. Touya answered the door and Kero quickly dodged out of sight seeing Yukito standing there holding a bag in his hand. He smiled when he saw Touya and said, "Hey Touya! I just bought a cake after school and thought you and Kero would want to share it with me!"

Kero flew back into sight, eyes eagerly on the bag in Yukito's hands. There was nothing he liked more than sweets! Yukito laughed when he saw Kero and said, "I thought you'd be excited."

So apparently Yukito knew about the whole Cardcaptor thing as well. It would've probably been hard keeping something like that from Yukito anyway. Touya stepped aside and let Yukito come in. Yukito took the cake out of the bag and brought it into the sitting room while Touya got some plates out of the cabinet. Kero flew forward and said, "Okay I want that piece, and that one, and, oooh, that one right there!"

"Don't be greedy Kero." Touya said, rapping Kero on the head with a fork as he set down the plates. Kero grabbed the sore spot on his head and said, "You don't have to be so mean!"

Touya cut out a piece of the cake and gave it to Kero who instantly cheered up and started eating, wielding a fork that was bigger than he was. Touya then cut a piece for Yukito and handed it over. Yukito reached out for the plate and his hand met Touya's. With a sudden flash of pink light, Touya and Kero watched in amazement as Yukito shrank out of sight! Within seconds the boy was no more than a few inches tall, laying unconscious in a pile of his own clothes. Kero freaked out and shouted, "You shrunk Yukito! How did you do that? You weren't using the Little card!"

Touya looked at his hands in surprise, seeing a slight pink aura surround them. The longer he watched, the fainter it got until it disappeared entirely. Touya then looked at Kero and said, "When the Little card glowed earlier I think I absorbed her power somehow."

Kero stopped freaking out and said, "That may be true. Clow Reed never mentioned anything like this happening before. Maybe you should wear gloves or something so you don't go around shrinking people!"

"If I touch Yukito again he should turn back to normal size right?" Touya said reaching out.

"There's no guarantee!" Kero shouted, waving his arms. "You could actually shrink him more! Or nothing could happen. It's too risky either way!"

But Touya wasn't listening. He reached into Yukito's collar and pulled the tiny boy out. Nothing happened. Kero sighed in relief, glad that Yukito wasn't going to shrink out of sight. Touya reached into his pocket and pulled out a handkerchief, wrapping it around Yukito like a blanket. He smiled as he watched his friend sleep, totally helpless. The longer he watched, the more Touya began to have strange feelings course through him. He had a human being in his hand, at his total mercy. The idea was intoxicating. Yet at the same time Touya felt how fragile Yukito was, how scared and confused he would be to be stuck at this size for who knows how long. Touya could bring him comfort, help him through it.

These thoughts were occupying his mind so completely he didn't notice Kero flying back upstairs to check the Clow Book. Kero opened it and pulled out the top two cards, Big and Little. Little was missing from her frame, and Big was as well. That meant that whatever had caused Touya to gain this power to shrink people had made sure he wouldn't be able to reverse it. At least for now. Kero flew back down and found Touya still sitting in the same place, staring at Yukito. Kero slowly flew back out of the room to give them some privacy. Touya was thinking hard about something and Kero didn't want to interrupt.

Touya still had feelings racing through him, inexplicable feelings. The question was which feelings would he act upon?

15522222121.content:
It had been 6 months since the crew of Outlaw Star had parted ways after they had found the Galactic Leyline. Aisha Clan Clan was once again on top of the world and had her own fleet of Ctarl Warships at her command. Suzuka had left the group in search of better bounties and had become a mercenary that mostly worked for Fred Lu. Fred Lu soon expanded his business and had become one of the fiercest underworld bosses the galaxy had ever seen. And Melfina had decided to start her life anew, and so she went on to live her life on a colony world known as Gamma 7.

And that left both Jim Hawking and Gene Starwind as the remaining crew of the Outlaw Star. Both of whom were doing their day to day jobs. Earning any money they could to help them along the way. And their recent mission was no different. They had been assigned the mission to grab and retrieve a special chemical known as "Agaris" which was known as 'The liquid of heavenly wishes' in Ctarl tongue. And so the two crewmates had retrieved it, fought a dozen bounty hunters who were after it, and had a run in with a carnivorous 50ft plant that was planted in the ship while they attempted to hold off the enemy. And while they did kill the plant and all the bounty hunters, the damage done was massive.

"Oh great!" Jim Hawking yelled angrily as he checked his computer for damage.

"What's wrong lil' buddy?' Gene asked from the captain's seat as he piloted them away from the planet they had gotten the Agaris from.

"The massive damage caused by that plant is going to be triple the amount were supposed to get for this Agaris!" Jim said as he looked back.

"WHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAT!?" Gene said as he stopped the ship and causing Jim to fall out of his seat. "They did that much damage!" He look bewildered as he looked on at hsi younger companion.

"Yeah they did. And unless we find a better job to do, we might end up having to ask Fred Luo for money again." Jim told him.

Gene's entire body turned white with shock. "Not that! I don't want to be in his debt even more!" Gene screamed in agony.

"I know what you mean. But unless we find someone who would spend that much on the Agaris, we might as well give up and ask Fred." Jim told him.

That's when Gene got the perfect idea. "Thats it! We could find someone who would pay that much it!"

"Your not serious are you?" Jim asked him with a sweatdrop. "Who would really pay that much for that vial?"

"Well it must be worth more than what that man is paying us. After all those people attempted to get it. And they told us that they were the only ones that were able to survive while grabbing this. So their must be loads of people after it!" Gene said happily. Jim just shrugged off Gene's statement. He knew this would be more trouble than what it's worth."Gilliam! Is the vial safe?"

"No Gene. During the attack the area where the vial is kept has left it tipping. Unless one of you go and get it it will fall and break." Gilliam told him.

"All righty then. Jim! Go get the vial!" Gene said as he began to pilot the ship again.

"Okay!" Jim said as he got out of his seat and headed through the ship to its back. Soon he arrived in front of the room with the vial, opening the door Jim gasped. "Oh no!" He shouted as he saw the vial was about to fall at any second. Quickly he attempted to grab the vial before it fell. But he was too late as the vial fell and crashed into thte ground. The vial turned into a gaseous form as it engulfed the room. Jim coughed as he breathed in the gas. "Darn it! I was too late." Jim had a sad look on his face. "Gene won't be happy." And so he headed back to the command center to inform Gene of the bad news.

And as he informed Gene of the bad news and their lives were totally screwed, Jim decided it was best if he went to bed for a while to let his mind rest. Not knowing what would happen to him as he slept.

How about KHR (Katekyo Hitman Reborn!)(only in jap.)? The Reborn! story revolves around a boy named Tsunayoshi "Tsuna" Sawada, who is chosen to become the Vongola Family's boss due to him being the great-great-great grandson of the first Vongola boss, who had moved to Japan from Italy during his time. Also, the other candidates for the position of the head of the Vongola Family died. For these reasons, Tsuna is the only remaining heir. As such, Timoteo a.k.a. "Vongola IX," the current head of the family, sends Reborn, an infant hitman from Italy, to train Tsuna. Tsuna then unwillingly undergoes training from Reborn. Reborn's main method of teaching Tsuna is the "Dying Will Bullet" ("Deathperation Shot" in Viz Media's translation of the manga), which will make the person be "reborn" with a stronger self intent on fulfilling his dying will. Through his experiences, Tsuna unconsciously becomes stronger and more confident, which ultimately makes him better suited as the Vongola Family's boss despite continuing to reject his Mafia inheritance.
